content:
The theorem docs#CategoryTheory.IsConnected.of_induct has parameters both Nonempty J and j₀ : J. I'd open a pull request to fix this, but do not know which of the following versions (or something else, or both) of the theorem should be used:

  1. Just remove the Nonempty-hypothesis. Probably make j₀ an explicit parameter then.
  2. Remove the parameter j₀. In this case the hypothesis h could be formulated by adding a universal quantifier over j₀.
The version 1. seems much better to me. (And it would also require minimum modifications on the rest of the code.)

I agree with Joël. Also, If j0 was implicit you could leave it as implicit. It's probably worth looking at all the applications of this result in mathlib and seeing whether people are constantly having to work around j0 being implicit before making a decision on changing it. Just nuke the typeclass :-)
Mathlib used this just three times, and both these as well as my use case did not care whether j0 is implicit. Then I won't change it. https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13598
Sven Manthe has marked this topic as resolved.
